name: RingoÂ¹

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hey there! Here's the rest of the payment I promised you back in Goodsprings.

topics.topic_text: PLAYER FIRE WEAPON
topics.response_text: Ammo costs money, you know!

topics.topic_text: PLAYER IN IRON SITES
topics.response_text: Stop that. I mean it!

topics.topic_text: PLAYER LAY MINE
topics.response_text: Hey, you dropped something.

topics.topic_text: PLAYER THROW GRENADE
topics.response_text: Run!

topics.topic_text: Who's in charge here?
topics.response_text: Alice McLafferty runs the Crimson Caravan. You can find her over in the main office.

topics.topic_text: So what's next for you?
topics.response_text: I'm getting ready to run a caravan up towards Utah. There's a town called New Canaan which is supposed to be pretty prosperous.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: I'll see you around.

topics.topic_text: Let's do this.
topics.response_text: All right, I'm ready. I hope.

topics.topic_text: Stay here for now. I'll see if there's anything else I can do first.
topics.response_text: All right. I'll just wait here until you come get me.

topics.topic_text: I've decided to kill you for Joe Cobb.
topics.response_text: What? No!

topics.topic_text: Where can I find more cards?
topics.response_text: Just keep an eye out for them while you travel. I've found cards in old boxes or forgotten on shelves. Can find some for sale, too.

topics.topic_text: Seems a little light for the work I did.
topics.response_text: It's all I've got with me, but if you look me up at the Crimson Caravan's main camp in New Vegas, I'll pay you in full.

topics.topic_text: You need a hired gun. I'm available.
topics.response_text: All I've got left on me are a handful of caps, but you get me out of this, and I'll make sure the Crimson Caravan pays you back. You've got my word.

topics.topic_text: I don't need payment.
topics.response_text: I won't let you stick your neck out for free. I can't pay you back now, but I'll make sure the Crimson Caravan pays up. You've got my word.

topics.topic_text: I'll consider it.
topics.response_text: All right. Was there anything else you wanted to talk to me about?

topics.topic_text: You're welcome.
topics.response_text: I'll stick around for a bit longer, but I'll be gone in a few days. If you ever visit New Vegas, look me up at the Crimson Caravan camp.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me anything about Goodsprings?
topics.response_text: I've never stopped here until recently. You're better off asking one of the locals.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about the Crimson Caravan Company.
topics.response_text: It's been in business for a very long time, and is probably the biggest trading outfit in California.

topics.topic_text: A man named Joe Cobb was looking for you, but I killed him.
topics.response_text: Err, thanks, I guess. Cobb wasn't the problem, though - I could've handled him if he ever found me.

topics.topic_text: Didn't I hear you say something earlier about not being able to pay me now?
topics.response_text: I did have what was left of the Crimson Caravan money, but I wasn't sure if it was my right to just give it away.

topics.topic_text: Is that the story you're going to stick with?
topics.response_text: [FAILED] Look, I don't know you, so what I'm doing here isn't any of your business.

topics.topic_text: Staying because you want to or because you have to? This is a good hiding spot.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] That is a pretty flimsy story, I guess. The real reason that I'm staying is because there's a group of men out to kill me.

topics.topic_text: What are the rules of Caravan?
topics.response_text: It's a two-player game, and the winner takes the whole pot. You build a "caravan" using the cards in your deck.

topics.topic_text: Let's play.
topics.response_text: Don't worry - I'm not that good of a player.

topics.topic_text: I don't have time for a game right now.
topics.response_text: All right.

topics.topic_text: I see.
topics.response_text: Did you want something else?

topics.topic_text: I'm not an enemy, if that's what you're asking.
topics.response_text: Sorry about the gun. You just caught me off guard, that's all.

topics.topic_text: Good luck with that.
topics.response_text: Yeah.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Yeah.

topics.topic_text: Let's play a hand of Caravan.
topics.response_text: Sure.

topics.topic_text: What do you do around here?
topics.response_text: Oh, sorry. I thought everybody knew already. I'm a trader with the Crimson Caravan Company.

topics.topic_text: Did you know there's a man named Joe Cobb looking for you?
topics.response_text: Yeah. He doesn't look very tough, though. I hear he's afraid I'll shoot him down from one of the windows when I see him, and he's right.

topics.topic_text: Why are the Powder Gangers out to get you?
topics.response_text: My caravan was on the return trip from California and heading back up to the company branch in New Vegas when we got jumped.

topics.topic_text: How many powder gangers are out there?
topics.response_text: At least a dozen, I'd say. And that was just the group that attacked us. For all I know, they've got a lot more friends lurking around.

topics.topic_text: What are you going to do about the Powder Gangers?
topics.response_text: I'm going to lay low for as long as I can, assuming the town doesn't throw me to the wolves. I've got no chance against the gang on my own.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I can help.
topics.response_text: I saw you being awfully friendly with Joe Cobb, so no thanks.

topics.topic_text: I'll ask around and see who I can round up.
topics.response_text: Start with Sunny Smiles. She's been friendlier than most around here.

topics.topic_text: You don't think I can handle myself in a fight?
topics.response_text: I was thinking of myself, actually. Who's going to watch my back while I'm watching yours?

topics.topic_text: Sunny's with us.
topics.response_text: Well, I guess that means we're ready to go. Unless you think there's something else you can do?

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Try to hurry.

topics.topic_text: I haven't talked to her yet.
topics.response_text: Oh. Well, I don't want to make a move until she's with us.

combat.response_text: What in the hell are you doing?

description:
Ringo is a 34 year-old Caucasian Male.

Ringo is a seasoned trader and caravan guard for the Crimson Caravan, one of the most prominent trading companies in the Mojave Wasteland. Currently, he's taking refuge in Goodsprings after a violent encounter with the Powder Gangers at Nipton. He's a resourceful individual with quick reflexes, honed by years of navigating the dangerous trade routes of the wasteland.

Ringo's Personality: Ringo is pragmatic, cautious, and street-smart. Having spent years as a caravan guard, he's developed a keen sense of danger and a distrust of newcomers. Despite his hardened exterior, he possesses a strong moral compass and a sense of duty to his fellow traders. He's quick-witted and can be sarcastic when nervous, which is often the case given his current predicament.

Ringo's Backstory: Ringo has been with the Crimson Caravan for over a decade, rising through the ranks from a simple guard to a trusted trader. He's made countless trips across the Mojave, establishing contacts in major settlements like New Vegas, Primm, and Novac. His most recent assignment was escorting a caravan to Nipton when they were ambushed by a large group of Powder Gangers. In the ensuing firefight, Ringo managed to eliminate several convicts before being overwhelmed and forced to flee. With the Powder Gangers in hot pursuit, Ringo found himself in Goodsprings, a small mining town on the edge of the Mojave. Recognizing the town's isolated nature and the presence of a few capable residents, he saw it as a temporary sanctuary. With the permission of Trudy, the local bartender and de facto mayor, he's been allowed to shelter at an abandoned gas station on the outskirts of town.
